Hahahahahaha. My shit. You guys are crazy! Its 7%. It used to be 6%. This 1% didnt break him because he was never op.  The items broke him + and the supps. There was once a certain team comp around called, protect koggy. They were picking certain champs to protect kog as much as possible because back then there wasnt op supp items.

Ok, I may be a biased ADC main, but think about that for a second. You are saying 1% didn't break him. 

While I agree, supports put a LOT of work into their ADCs on these patches, let's think about this for a second.

Pretending Kog's auto's deal ONLY damage based off W: 
Kog needs 17 autos to deal 100% max health magic damage with 6% per auto.
Kog needs 15 Autos to deal 100% max health magic damage with 7% per auto.

Now think about the fact that Guinsoo gives him 59 ability power (which rounds up to .6% max health damage)
Kog needs 14 auto attacks to deal that much max health damage with 7.6% max health damage, meaning .6% HP shaves off an entire auto which is crucial during his short time window for W.

Now think about a fully stacked guinsoo dealing damage every other auto twice at 7.6% damage. 

Kog'maw can now kill you within 8 auto attacks, given that he times his first auto to double proc his w.
At 6.6%, kogmaw needs 11 auto attacks, even under perfect conditions to deal 100% max hp magic damage. 

1% max HP can be the difference between killing in 8 autos or 11. Keep in mind, this is not counting things like resistances, his base autos, or other on hit modifiers, such as the base damage from runaans. That means that 1% magic damage actually decreased his time to kill by 27%
While i agree with all of these, you have to keep in mind that this works only  if we dont take into account resistances. Fortunately for us resistances do fantastic job against hybrid dmg.
With resistances the damage difference 1% makes is even greater. Think about the difference when between 1% and 1.2%

This, it becomes exponentially more clear just how fucking undervalued and blatantly overpowered % hp damage is the further into the calculations you go.  If we converted it to straight AP/AD values the passive on BoTRK alone (which is % current hp, mind you) would be worth several thousand gold, on average, against a target with as little as 1,500 hp.   I'm just glad Kog's W is not physical % hp damage that he could then scale with LDR.

I couldn't agree more. Kog should be scaling in the late game, not mid-game. That or he needs to have his scaling redefined.

most of the scalings are fine: the offensive items themselves need a universal tone-down. ever since the juggernaut update, every change sneaks a tiny bit more damage in, and it's been accelerating the game. Now the mid-game arrives faster than ever, and late game faster than ever, and people's decision making is not on that mark, nor is the use and ubuse of power spike timing across a team. Thus, as those late game moments arrive earlier, it's msotly just those with the highest late spike that are seen.


The multiple layered bonuses to shielding and healing making it impossible to one shot these carries, and the offensive additives other chamipons can put on them, ends up multiplying this issue. Take out the extra damage, watch most of these issues disperse.

Kog'maw is one of those champions (along with maybe Kayle) that thrives in long-duration teamfights. He's not that bursty - at least, no more so than your average champion building AD items - but when he has a chance to ramp Guinsoo's all the way up, he does an absolutely horrifying amount of damage.

There are two things you can try to do:

1. If you're tanky, *build attack speed slows.* Kog'maw's ultimate is essentially only good at finishing off fleeing people, and his slime spit is really just there to keep you in place. The vast majority of his damage is AA based. The goal here is to make him take longer to hit 6 stacks on Guinsoo's.

2. If you're squishy, don't engage him while he has Guinsoo's fully stacked. A 6-stack Kog'maw or Kayle is going to do 50-70% more damage, possibly more. Kog'maw with no stacks won't be able to kill a fed Yi before he can hit Q. A 6-stack Kog'maw can kill Yi before he gets into alpha strike range.

> f you're tanky, build attack speed slows.

Well there aren't that great options for attack speed slows there are only {{item:3143}} / {{item:3075}} + {{item:3110}} (and it only giving armor makes it kind of bad against all of the magic damage kog'maw has)

The goal isn't really to soak the damage with resist, but stop it from going out altogether - especially since Kog has pretty decent shred from wit's end. You want some resistances, sure, but you're not going to be able to out-sustain a 6-stack guinsoo's Kog'Maw as anyone. The goal is to stop him from reaching six stacks, and to minimize the number of hits you take while he's at six stacks.
Attack Speed Slows help a lot.

Best way to beat Kog is to have effective zone control and engage/disengage tools.

I think Rakan is a pretty good example:

Dash in, hit Kog - he presses w, hos team uses some peel. Dash back out, wait for w/shields to fall off, then engage, **hard**

Kog is basically worthless without W up, and if you can bait out some meaningful peel while you're at it his team has nothing left.


I don't know why the boards are freaking out so much about that one game, diving head first into kog was never the answer to a protect-the-kog comp - the answers are poke, when it's strong, rotations when it isn't (the team's effective rotation speed is limited by kog'waddle, as the rest of such a comp has poor damage), and just kinda playing and moving around Kog and his W. 

Set the terms of the fight, and set them as something other than "Run face-first into Kog with his W up and his full team peeling him. That **can** work if you have a big gold advantage and a solid dive comp {{champion:59}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:412}} but it's always risky as hell to just run at Kog and try to outdamage him - it basically the teamfights equivalent of a base race.
Try {{champion:29}} + {{item:3087}} + {{item:3031}}, it counters everything.

Kog'Maw's %HP damage is magic.

Magic resist reduces it.
Adaptive Helm reduces it.

Even if it's hp % damage, it's still magic damage or physical damage, so it will always get lowered by armor or magic resist. One tip I should give you, is don't build the item that you need. Build the item that you will need.
